original: Ahorātravratakathā
analyzed: ahorātra vrata kathā
translated: The Story of the Day and Night Vow

original: oṃ namo dharmadhātave /
analyzed: om namaḥ dharmadhātave
translated: Om, homage to the Dharmadhatu.

original: ākāśanirmalo bhūto niṣprapañcaguṇāśrayaḥ /
translated: Being pure like the sky, the abode of the quality of non-conceptuality,

original: pañcaskandhātmakaḥ śāntas tasmai stūpātmane namaḥ // //
analyzed: pañca skandha ātmakaḥ śāntaḥ tasmai stūpa ātmane namaḥ  /
translated: peaceful, consisting of the five aggregates, homage to him, the essence of the stupa.

original: ekasminn antare kāle bhagavān kapilavastuni mahānagare viharati sma sārdhaṃ pañcamātrair
analyzed: ekasmin antare kāle bhagavān kapilavastuni mahā nagare viharati sma sārdham pañca mātraiḥ
translated: At one time, the Blessed One was dwelling in the great city of Kapilavastu, together with five hundred monks

original: bhikṣuśataiḥ saṃbahulaiś ca kṛtakṛtyair jitendriyaiḥ kṣīṇāsravair anyaiś ca bodhisattvaśataiḥ
analyzed: bhikṣu śataiḥ saṃbahulaiḥ ca kṛtakṛtyaiḥ jita indriyaiḥ kṣīṇa āsravaiḥ anyaiḥ ca bodhisattva śataiḥ
translated: who had accomplished their purpose, who had conquered their senses, who had exhausted their defilements, and with many other hundreds of bodhisattvas

original: ṣaṭpāramitānirjātaiḥ pañcacakṣusamanvāgatair anekaiḥ śrāvakamukhyair anuttarapuṇyakṣetre
analyzed: ṣaṣ pāramitā nirjātaiḥ pañca cakṣu samanvāgataiḥ anekaiḥ śrāvaka mukhyaiḥ anuttara puṇya kṣetre
translated: who had arisen from the six perfections, who were endowed with the five eyes, with many foremost disciples, who were dwelling in the unsurpassed field of merit,

original: nivāsitair buddhaśāsanaratibhir anekair devanāgayakṣādibhiḥ parimaṇḍitaiḥ sapārṣadaparipūrṇaiḥ /
analyzed: nivāsitaiḥ buddha śāsana ratibhiḥ anekaiḥ deva nāga yakṣa ādibhiḥ parimaṇḍitaiḥ sa pārṣada paripūrṇaiḥ
translated: who were delighted in the Buddha's teachings, and who were surrounded by many gods, nagas, yakshas, and others, who were complete with their retinues.

original: tatsabhāyāṃ subhūtir vajradharam evam āha /
analyzed: tad sabhāyām subhūtiḥ vajradharam evam āha
translated: In that assembly, Subhuti said this to Vajrapani:

original: vajradhara śrīmān muniśārdūlas tatsabhāyām anekadevanāgayakṣādisaṃmilite naikagiram ājñāṃ nāvabhāṣitaṃ kim /
analyzed: vajradhara śrīmān muni śārdūlaḥ tad sabhāyām aneka deva nāga yakṣa ādi saṃmilite na eka giram ājñām na avabhāṣitam kim
translated: O Vajrapani, the glorious tiger among sages, in that assembly, which was filled with many gods, nagas, yakshas, and others, why did he not speak a single word of instruction?

original: kimabhilāṣo bhavasi subhūte yathābhiprāyas tathā vijñāpaya śākyamunau /
analyzed: kimabhilāṣaḥ bhavasi subhūte yathā abhiprāyaḥ tathā vijñāpaya śākyamunau
translated: What is your desire, Subhuti? Speak as you wish to Shakyamuni.

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhuti said:

original: narāṇām uttamaṃ vrataṃ yad ahorātravrataṃ vratarājaṃ mahodayaṃ mamābhilāṣaḥ /
analyzed: narāṇām uttamam vratam yat ahorātravratam vratarājam mahodayam mama abhilāṣaḥ
translated: The supreme vow of men is the one-day vow, the king of vows, the great rising. That is my desire.

original: ity ukte mahānumataṃ sādaraṃ kṛtvā vajradharo bhagavantam evam āha /
analyzed: iti ukte mahā anumatam sa ādaram kṛtvā vajradharaḥ bhagavantam evam āha
translated: When this was said, the greatly approved Vajra Holder, having respectfully made obeisance, said this to the Blessed One:

original: bhagavan muniśārdūla giram ekam api nāvabhāṣitam /
analyzed: bhagavat muni śārdūla giram ekam api na avabhāṣitam
translated: Blessed One, O best of sages, not even a single word has been spoken.

original: sarvasabhājanānām abhilaṣitaṃ subhūtir iti vratarājaṃ mahodayaṃ yad ahorātravratopāyikām abhilāṣiko 'ham ity āha /
analyzed: sarva sabhājanānām abhilaṣitam subhūtiḥ iti vrata rājam mahodayam yat ahorātra vrata upāyikām abhilāṣikaḥ ham iti āha
translated: The desire of all the assemblies is that Subhuti should speak the king of vows, the great rising, that he is desirous of the means of the one-day vow.

original: tat sakalaṃ prabhāṣaya tvaṃ munīśvara /
analyzed: tat sakalam prabhāṣaya tvam muni īśvara
translated: Therefore, O Lord of sages, speak it all.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: sādhu sādhu vajradhara lokānāṃ hitahetunā pṛcchitaṃ saphalaṃ pūrayāmi /
analyzed: sādhu sādhu vajradhara lokānām hita hetunā pṛcchitam sa phalam pūrayāmi
translated: Well said, well said, O Vajra Holder, for the sake of the welfare of the world, you ask. I shall fulfill it.

original: ity uktvā śrīdharmadhātusamādhau sthitavān /
analyzed: iti uktvā śrī dharmadhātu samādhau sthitavān
translated: Having said this, he remained in the glorious Dharma-Dhatu Samadhi.

original: nāsikāgre mahāpadme dharmajvalaṃ samujjvalan /
analyzed: nāsikā agre mahā padme dharma jvalam samujjvalan
translated: In the great lotus at the tip of the nose, the Dharma-flame blazed forth.

original: avabhāsya diśān sarvāṃs tatsabhāyāṃ virājate // //
analyzed: avabhāsya diśān sarvān tat sabhāyām virājate  /
translated: Illuminating all the directions, it shines in that assembly.

original: tadā sarvaparṣadajanāḥ ke cit paraṃ dharmasubhāṣitaṃ ke cid bhagavato vaco'mṛtakaṃ pātum / / / /
analyzed: tadā sarva parṣada janāḥ ke cid param dharma su bhāṣitam ke cid bhagavataḥ vacaḥ mṛtakam pātum
translated: Then all the people in the assembly, some the excellent Dharma teaching, some the nectar-like words of the Blessed One,

original: tathaivānye kathāḥ parasparaṃ pravāditāḥ /
analyzed: tathā eva anye kathāḥ parasparam pravāditāḥ
translated: and likewise others conversing with each other,

original: te parṣadajanāḥ sādhu bhagavadraśmayaḥ prādurbhūtā avaśyaṃ dharmakathāṃ pratibhāṣayiṣyati /
analyzed: te parṣada janāḥ sādhu bhagavat raśmayaḥ prādurbhūtāḥ avaśyam dharma kathām pratibhāṣayiṣyati
translated: those people in the assembly said, Excellent! The rays of the Blessed One have appeared. He will surely speak the Dharma story.

original: tadā vajradharaḥ punar apy uvāca /
analyzed: tadā vajradharaḥ punar api uvāca
translated: Then Vajradhara said again:

original: sādhu bhagavan mahāprabha kasmin bhagavan pṛthivyāṃ kena saṃcāritam ahorātravrataṃ brūhi me parameśvara /
analyzed: sādhu bhagavat mahāprabha kasmin bhagavan pṛthivyām kena saṃcāritam ahorātra vratam brūhi me parameśvara
translated: Excellent, Blessed One, Great Light! In which earth, Blessed One, by whom was the day and night vow transmitted? Tell me, Supreme Lord.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: śṛṇu vajradhara mahātejaṃ vratānām uttamaṃ vrataṃ pṛthivyāṃ pāvanīkathām /
analyzed: śṛṇu vajradhara mahā tejam vratānām uttamam vratam pṛthivyām pāvanī kathām
translated: Listen, Vajradhara, of great splendor, the supreme vow of vows, the purifying story on earth.

original: purātanīkāle uttaradigbhāge dharmapattano nāma mahānagarī āsīd maghavatpattanasamā sujanamuttamaiḥ paripūritā /
analyzed: purātanī kāle uttara digbhāge dharmapattanaḥ nāma mahā nagarī āsīt maghavat pattana samā su jana muttamaiḥ paripūritā
translated: In ancient times, in the northern direction, there was a great city named Dharmapatana, equal to Indra's city, filled with excellent good people.

original: kathaṃ vistāritā nagarī /
analyzed: katham vistāritā nagarī
translated: How was the city expanded?

original: saptayojanasaṃvṛtā vyāyāmavistīrṇā bhavati / / / / tālapaṅktibhiḥ parikhābhiś ca parirundhyamānā mahotsavā /
analyzed: sapta yojana saṃvṛtā vyāyāma vistīrṇā bhavati tāla paṅktibhiḥ parikhābhiḥ ca parirundhyamānā mahā utsavā
translated: It is surrounded by seven yojanas, with a width of one yojana, and is surrounded by rows of palm trees and moats, with great festivals.

original: tadūrdhvaṃ trikūṭaparvato 'sti /
analyzed: tad ūrdhvam trikūṭa parvataḥ sti
translated: Above that, there is Trikuta mountain.

original: nānāvṛkṣasamākīrṇaṃ nānāpakṣigaṇasadārataṃ nānākusumasugandhavāsitam anekarṣibhiḥ suvāsitaṃ trikūṭam eva /
analyzed: nānā vṛkṣa samākīrṇam nānā pakṣi gaṇa sa dāratam nānā kusuma sugandha vāsitam aneka ṛṣibhiḥ su vāsitam trikūṭam eva
translated: It is filled with various trees, inhabited by flocks of various birds, fragrant with various flowers, and well-perfumed by the Anekarṣis. Trikuta itself.

original: anekaśūrasamākīrṇānekavidvajjanāvṛtā nānāśilpajñasamāpannā bhiṣagvaraprabhṛtinānāsupuruṣaparipūrṇā bhavati nagarī kālavedīkālajñasamayajñacaittajñamantrīsamāpannā 🔽ca /
analyzed: aneka śūra samākīrṇa aneka vidvas jana āvṛtā nānā śilpa jña samāpannā bhiṣaj vara prabhṛti nānā su puruṣa paripūrṇā bhavati nagarī kālavedī kāla jña samaya jña caitta jña mantrī samāpannā  ca
translated: The city is filled with many heroes, surrounded by many learned people, endowed with various skilled craftsmen, and fully populated by various excellent men such as physicians. It is endowed with ministers who know the right time, know the occasion, know the moment, and know the mind.

original: tasyāṃ nagaryāṃ dharmadakṣo nāma rājā babhūva nayavinayavivekavidhijñaḥ
analyzed: tasyām nagaryām dharmadakṣaḥ nāma rājā babhūva naya vinaya viveka vidhi jñaḥ
translated: In that city, there was a king named Dharmadakṣa, who knew the rules of policy, discipline, and discernment.

original: prajāvatsalasvabhāvaḥ paraduḥkhaṃ sukhaṃ vā svātmani vedanīyo dayāvān dharmatrāṇadharmaparāyaṇaḥ
analyzed: prajā vatsala svabhāvaḥ para duḥkham sukham vā sva ātmani vedanīyaḥ dayāvān dharma trāṇa dharma parāyaṇaḥ
translated: He was naturally affectionate towards his subjects, and felt his own pain or pleasure in the pain or pleasure of others. He was compassionate, devoted to the Dharma, and took refuge in the Dharma.

original: parakāryeṣu mahotsavaḥ /
analyzed: para kāryeṣu mahā utsavaḥ
translated: He was greatly enthusiastic in the affairs of others.

original: tasya patnī suvratī sadā dharmacāriṇī vidyāguṇasaṃpannā /
analyzed: tasya patnī suvratī sadā dharma cāriṇī vidyā guṇa saṃpannā
translated: His wife was Suvrati, always practicing the Dharma, endowed with knowledge and good qualities.

original: atha tasmin samaye tatra trikūṭaparvate śāriputro nāma mahātmāyuṣmān jainajño buddhajñānavidāṃ varo viharati /
analyzed: atha tasmin samaye tatra trikūṭa parvate śāriputraḥ nāma mahātmā āyuṣmān jaina jñaḥ buddha jñāna vidām varaḥ viharati
translated: At that time, on that Trikuta mountain, there was a great being named Shariputra, a long-lived one, a Jain scholar, the best among those who know the Buddha's teachings.

original: tadā śāriputro 'nuvicintayati /
analyzed: tadā śāriputraḥ nu vicintayati
translated: Then Shariputra thought,

original: ko dharmavatsalo dharmaparāyaṇo dharmacaraṇo 'sti kasminn iti /
analyzed: kaḥ dharma vatsalaḥ dharma parāyaṇaḥ dharma caraṇaḥ sti kasmin iti
translated: Who is devoted to the Dharma, who is intent on the Dharma, who practices the Dharma? Where is he?

original: tatkṣaṇāt smṛtya darśitam ity uktam /
analyzed: tad kṣaṇāt smṛtya darśitam iti uktam
translated: It was said that he was shown by his memory at that very moment.

original: darśito dharmacaraṇo dharmavatsalo dharmaparāyaṇo dharmadakṣo nāma rājā asti /
analyzed: darśitaḥ dharma caraṇaḥ dharma vatsalaḥ dharma parāyaṇaḥ dharmadakṣaḥ nāma rājā asti
translated: It was shown that there was a king named Dharmachara, devoted to the Dharma, intent on the Dharma, skilled in the Dharma.

original: taṃ dharmaṃ deśayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: tam dharmam deśayiṣyāmi
translated: I will teach him the Dharma.

original: ity uktvā dharmapattanaṃ mahānagarīṃ gatavān samanuprāptaḥ /
analyzed: iti uktvā dharmapattanam mahā nagarīm gatavān samanuprāptaḥ
translated: Having said this, he went to the great city of Dharmapattana and arrived there.

original: tatra prāsādamekam asti /
analyzed: tatra prāsādam ekam asti
translated: There is a palace there.

original: tasmin tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: tasmin tiṣṭhati
translated: He stayed there.

original: sa tato 'nekadharmakathanena sthitavān /
analyzed: sa tatas neka dharma kathanena sthitavān
translated: He remained there with many Dharma teachings.

original: taṃ sarvajanās tatra prāsādikena sādhukāram adāt /
analyzed: tam sarva janāḥ tatra prāsādikena sādhukāram adāt
translated: All the people there gave him a pleasant well done.

original: tataḥ ke cit satpuruṣāḥ śiṣyatvam anugacchanti tasya /
analyzed: tatas ke cid sat puruṣāḥ śiṣya tvam anugacchanti tasya
translated: Then some good people followed him as disciples.

original: atha dharmadakṣo mahārājā sarvavṛttāntam anumataṃ śrutvā savicāram ādareṇa sagauraveṇa mahotsavena rājakule praveśayati vāsanabhaktena
analyzed: atha dharmadakṣaḥ mahā rājā sarva vṛttāntam anumatam śrutvā sa vicāram ādareṇa sa gauraveṇa mahā utsavena rājakule praveśayati vāsana bhaktena
translated: Then King Dharmadhvaja, having heard the entire matter approved, respectfully and with reverence, with great joy, had it brought into the royal palace with fragrant food.

original: pratiṣṭhāpayati /
analyzed: pratiṣṭhāpayati
translated: He established it.

original: atha śāriputro rājānam āśīrvacanam abravīt /
analyzed: atha śāriputraḥ rājānam āśīrvacanam abravīt
translated: Then Śāriputra spoke the benediction to the king:

original: saddharmaṃ kurutāṃ svasti saddharmaṃ kurutāṃ vatsa saddharmaṃ kurutāṃ mokṣaṃ sarvakāmā bhavantu vaḥ /
analyzed: saddharmam kurutām svasti saddharmam kurutām vatsa saddharmam kurutām mokṣam sarva kāmāḥ bhavantu vaḥ
translated: May you have the true Dharma, may you have the true Dharma, my child. May you have the true Dharma, may you have liberation, may all your desires be fulfilled.

original: atha sa rājā praharṣeṇa āśīrvacanam ākarṇya śāriputram evam āha /
analyzed: atha sa rājā praharṣeṇa āśīrvacanam ākarṇya śāriputram evam āha
translated: Then the king, having heard the benediction with joy, said this to Śāriputra:

original: vibho śāriputra katham āśīrvacanaṃ tava /
analyzed: vibho śāriputra katham āśīrvacanam tava
translated: Lord Śāriputra, how is the benediction to be done for me?

original: kaś cid buddho vā devo vā devī vā maheśvaro vā nārāyaṇo vānyo vā rakṣatv ity āśīrvacanaṃ mahyaṃ dadyāt /
analyzed: kaḥ cit buddhaḥ vā devaḥ vā devī vā maheśvaraḥ vā nārāyaṇaḥ vā anyaḥ vā rakṣatu iti āśīrvacanam mahyam dadyāt
translated: Who, whether a Buddha, a god, a goddess, Maheśvara, Nārāyaṇa, or anyone else, would give me the benediction 'May you have the true Dharma'?

original: saddharmaṃ kurutām iti dadāsi /
analyzed: saddharmam kurutām iti dadāsi
translated: You give the benediction 'May you have the true Dharma.'

original: saddharmaṃ na jānāmi bhagavan saddharmaṃ bhāṣatu mahāmate /
analyzed: saddharmam na jānāmi bhagavan saddharmam bhāṣatu mahāmate
translated: I do not know the true Dharma, Blessed One. May the greatly wise one speak the true Dharma.

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: na jānāsi maharaja dharmāṇāṃ dharmam uttamam /
analyzed: na jānāsi maharaja dharmāṇām dharmam uttamam
translated: Great king, you do not know the supreme Dharma of dharmas.

original: dharmadhātuṃ kathaṃ nāma dharmo nāmākaraṃ varam // //
analyzed: dharmadhātum katham nāma dharmaḥ nāma akaram varam
translated: How is the Dharma realm, the supreme source of the Dharma, to be named?

original: śṛṇu rājan mahāteja prathamato dharmadhātuprasaṃskāraṃ kṛtvā ahorātravrataṃ kārayet /
analyzed: śṛṇu rājan mahā teja prathamatas dharmadhātu prasaṃskāram kṛtvā ahorātra vratam kārayet
translated: Listen, O king of great splendor! First, having made preparations for the Dharma realm, one should observe the one-day vow.

original: atha cāśrame vā nagare vihāre vā anye vā yatra dharmadhātur asti tatrāhorātravrataṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: atha ca āśrame vā nagare vihāre vā anye vā yatra dharmadhātuḥ asti tatra ahorātra vratam kuryāt
translated: Then, in a hermitage, a city, a monastery, or elsewhere where the Dharma realm exists, one should observe the one-day vow.

original: aharniśam ahorātraṃ saddharmaṃ tad vratam iti purā tathāgataiḥ /
analyzed: aharniśam ahar rātram saddharmam tat vratam iti purā tathāgataiḥ
translated: Day and night, day and night, that is the vow of the true Dharma, as stated by the Tathāgatas in the past.

original: rājovāca /
analyzed: rājā uvāca
translated: The king said:

original: kathaṃ vidhividhānādīn kathyatāṃ bhikṣusattama /
analyzed: katham vidhi vidhāna ādīn kathyatām bhikṣu sattama
translated: How are the procedures and so forth to be explained? Tell me, O best of monks.

original: vratarājaṃ tu saṃsāre dinamāsādikaṃ kramāt // //
translated: The king of vows, in the world, for days, months, and so on, in order.

original: śāriputra uvāca /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ uvāca
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: prathame mahārāja yavodakasthāpanaṃ kuryāc catasradevatāsthāpanaṃ dharmadhātuprabhṛtasya /
analyzed: prathame mahā rāja yava udaka sthāpanam kuryāt catasra devatā sthāpanam dharmadhātu prabhṛtasya
translated: In the first, O great king, one should establish barley water and the four deities of the Dharma realm and so on.

original: icchanti ye sattvā brahmakṣatriyavaiśyaśūdrādayaś caturjātivrataṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: icchanti ye sattvāḥ brahma kṣatriya vaiśya śūdra ādayaḥ catur jāti vratam kuryāt
translated: Those beings who desire it, of the four castes such as brahmin, kṣatriya, vaiśya, and śūdra, should observe the vow of the four castes.

original: ṣoḍaśaviṃśatijātibhir anyaiḥ svasvayogyaś ca yujyate /
analyzed: ṣoḍaśa viṃśati jātibhiḥ anyaiḥ sva sva yogyaḥ ca yujyate
translated: With the sixteen and twenty castes and others, each one is suitable for their own.

original: rājan māsāśvinīśuklapakṣe caturdaśyāṃ dantadhāvanaṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: rājan māsa āśvinī śukla pakṣe caturdaśyām dantadhāvanam kuryāt
translated: O king, in the month of Āśvina, on the fourteenth day of the bright fortnight, one should clean the teeth.

original: kṣurakarmaśucisnānaṃ madhyāhne dāyadānaṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: kṣura karma śuci snānam madhyāhne dāya dānam kuryāt
translated: One should perform the rite of shaving and bathing in the middle of the day.

original: tataḥ sūrye ṣaṣṭe gate śālyodanaṃ bhojanaṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: tatas sūrye ṣaṣṭe gate śālyodanam bhojanam kuryāt
translated: Then, when sixty ghatis of the sun have passed, one should eat rice and barley.

original: tato mukhaprakṣālanaṃ / / / / / / paścāt /
analyzed: tatas mukha prakṣālanam paścāt
translated: Then, after washing the face,

original: tadā vyākhyānaṃ śṛṇuyāt tataḥ /
analyzed: tadā vyākhyānam śṛṇuyāt tatas
translated: one should listen to the explanation then.

original: rātrau trayārdhaprahare rājan sarve samutthāya pratyūṣavelāyāṃ snātvā kriyākāraṃ kṛtvā śucivastraṃ prāvṛtya vrataṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: rātrau traya ardha prahare rājan sarve samutthāya pratyūṣa velāyām snātvā kriyākāram kṛtvā śuci vastram prāvṛtya vratam kuryāt
translated: At night, O king, all should rise at three ghatis before dawn, bathe, perform the rites, put on clean clothes, and observe the vow.

original: pañcadevatāmaṇḍalaṃ kṛtvā apatitagomayenopalipyārghaṃ dattvā ca stūpāya puṣpadhūpadīpagandhanaivedyavīṇāvaṃśamṛdaṅgamurajapaṭahatālaśaṅkhadhvajacchattragītanṛtyādīn
analyzed: pañca devatā maṇḍalam kṛtvā a patita gomayena upalipya argham dattvā ca stūpāya puṣpa dhūpa dīpa gandha naivedya vīṇā vaṃśa mṛdaṅga muraja paṭaha tāla śaṅkha dhvaja chattra gīta nṛtya ādīn
translated: Having made a mandala of the five deities, having anointed with cow dung that has not fallen, having offered a libation to the stupa, having offered flowers, incense, lamps, perfumes, food, lutes, flutes, drums, kettledrums, cymbals, conches, banners, parasols, songs, dances, and so on,

original: ṣoḍaśavidhim arcanai rājan nānotsavaprapūritaiḥ prathame pañcapradakṣiṇaṃ kārayet /
analyzed: ṣoḍaśa vidhim arcanaiḥ rājan nānā utsava prapūritaiḥ prathame pañca pradakṣiṇam kārayet
translated: having worshipped with the sixteen articles, O king, with various festivals and offerings, one should make five clockwise circumambulations in the first watch.

original: stutiṃ buddhe pragīyate /
analyzed: stutim buddhe pragīyate
translated: Praise is sung to the Buddha.

original: lājākṣataṃ sapuṣpaṃ ca caityamūrdhni prakṣipet /
analyzed: lāja akṣatam sa puṣpam ca caitya mūrdhni prakṣipet
translated: One should scatter fried grain, unbroken rice, and flowers on the top of the caitya.

original: atha rājovāca /
analyzed: atha rājā uvāca
translated: Then the king said:

original: bhikṣusattama mahāprājña ahorātravrataṃ ekasthāne vā dvitīye vānye vā kim u /
analyzed: bhikṣu sattama mahā prājña ahorātra vratam eka sthāne vā dvitīye vā anye vā kim
translated: O best of monks, O greatly wise one, is the one-day-and-night vow to be observed in one place, or in a second or other place?

original: śāriputra uvāca /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ uvāca
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: naikasthāne maharaja yatra caityaṃ pratiṣṭhati /🔽yatra devālaye caitye yatra tīrthasya saṃgame /
analyzed: na eka sthāne yatra caityam pratiṣṭhati  yatra devālaye caitye yatra tīrthasya saṃgame
translated: Not in one place, great king, where a caitya is established.🔽Where in a temple, caitya, or at the confluence of a sacred ford,

original: yatra yatra manoramye buddhakṣetre pracaṅkrame // //
analyzed: yatra yatra manas ramye buddhakṣetre pracaṅkrame  /
translated: wherever it is delightful, in a Buddha-field, one should wander.

original: rājovāca / kathaṃ nātha pramāṇaṃ ca yaticaityapradakṣiṇaṃ saṃpūrṇaṃ yāvat tāvad dinaṃ kiṃ vā /
analyzed: rājā uvāca katham nātha pramāṇam ca yati caitya pradakṣiṇam saṃpūrṇam yāvat tāvat dinam kim vā
translated: The king said: How is the measure, O Lord, of circumambulating a monk's caitya, whether it is complete or not, or for how many days?

original: śāriputra uvāca /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ uvāca
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: naiva mahārāja yatināṃ nidrā na viśrāmaṃ na dhāvitaṃ kiṃ cit / / / / / / / īdṛkpramāṇa iti /
analyzed: na eva mahā rāja yatinām nidrā na viśrāmam na dhāvitam kim cit īdṛś pramāṇaḥ iti
translated: O great king, for monks there is neither sleep, nor rest, nor running at all. It is not like this, that it is such a measure.

original: rājovāca /
analyzed: rājā uvāca
translated: The king said:

original: samartho 'samartho vā tasya vivekaṃ kathaya prabho /
analyzed: samarthaḥ samarthaḥ vā tasya vivekam kathaya prabho
translated: Whether able or unable, tell me, O Lord, its distinction.

original: śāriputra uvāca /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ uvāca
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: ke cid asamarthā vā bālavṛddhā vā ahorātravrataṃ na kartavyaṃ mahārājeti /
analyzed: ke cit asamarthāḥ vā bāla vṛddhāḥ vā ahorātra vratam na kartavyam mahā rāja iti
translated: Some, whether able or unable, whether children or old, should not perform the one-day-and-night vow, O great king.

original: rājovāca /
analyzed: rājā uvāca
translated: The king said:

original: kathaṃ bhikṣo mahāprājña asamarthā bālavṛddhāś ca dharmapratilabdhā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: katham bhikṣo mahā prājña asamarthāḥ bāla vṛddhāḥ ca dharma pratilabdhāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: How, O monk, O greatly wise one, will the unable, the children and the old, obtain the Dharma?

original: śāriputra uvāca /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ uvāca
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: upavāsoṣito bhūtvā caityārcanaṃ snānādikaṃ kṛtvā japastotraṃ ca kārayet /
analyzed: upavāsa uṣitaḥ bhūtvā caitya arcanam snāna ādikam kṛtvā japa stotram ca kārayet
translated: Having fasted, one should perform the worship of the caitya, bathing and so forth, and perform the recitation and praise.

original: asamarthānāṃ tathā punar bālānāṃ abhilāṣaṃ yadā dinam ekaṃ vā dinārdhaṃ vā praharam ekaṃ vā upavāsoṣito bhūtvā caityārcanaṃ ekadvitripradakṣiṇaṃ
analyzed: asamarthānām tathā punar bālānām abhilāṣam yadā dinam ekam vā dina ardham vā praharam ekam vā upavāsa uṣitaḥ bhūtvā caitya arcanam eka dvi tri pradakṣiṇam
translated: For those who are unable, and likewise for children, when there is a desire, having fasted for one day or half a day or one watch of the day, having performed the worship of the caitya, one or two or three circumambulations

original: yathāśakti kartavyaṃ mahārājeti /
analyzed: yathāśakti kartavyam mahā rāja iti
translated: should be done according to one's ability, saying Great King.

original: vrataniyamaṃ kathaṃ bhikṣo bhakṣabhojyaṃ kathaṃ punar vrataṃ pūrṇaṃ kathaṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: vrata niyamam katham bhikṣaḥ bhakṣa bhojyam katham punar vratam pūrṇam katham kuryāt
translated: How should the monk observe the vow, and what should he eat? How should he complete the vow?

original: vrataparyantakaṃ katham /
analyzed: vrata paryantakam katham
translated: How should he end the vow?

original: śāriputra uvāca /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ uvāca
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: śucisnānādikaṃ kṛtvā cittam antargatamīkṣayet sarvaśuklopacāreṇa sugandhakusumayuktena🔽nihatadaṇḍaśastreṇa nihataprāṇivadhena nihatādattadānena nihatakāmācāreṇa tyaktapiśunena
analyzed: śuci snāna ādikam kṛtvā cittam antargatam īkṣayet sarva śukla upacāreṇa su gandha kusuma yuktena  nihata daṇḍa śastreṇa nihata prāṇi vadhena nihata a datta dānena nihata kāma ācāreṇa tyakta piśunena
translated: Having performed pure bathing and so forth, one should contemplate the mind within, with all pure conduct, endowed with fragrant flowers,🔽without punishment or weapons, without killing living beings, without stealing, without engaging in sexual activity, having abandoned slander,

original: tyaktabhinnabhāṣanena tyaktādṛṣṭavacanena tyaktapāruṣakavacanena ca na cābhidhyādhānena
analyzed: tyakta bhinna bhāṣanena tyakta adṛṣṭa vacanena tyakta pāruṣaka vacanena ca na ca abhidhyā ādhānena
translated: having abandoned divisive speech, having abandoned false speech, having abandoned harsh speech, and not intent on covetousness,

original: na ca vyāpādacittena na ca mithyādṛṣṭigrahaṇena naiva lavaṇabhojanena naiva madyapānapipāsena
analyzed: na ca vyāpāda cittena na ca mithyādṛṣṭi grahaṇena na eva lavaṇa bhojanena na eva madya pāna pipāsena
translated: Not with a malicious mind, not with the grasping of wrong views, not with the eating of salt, not with the thirst for drinking alcohol,

original: naiva māṃsāhāreṇa vinā uccaśayyāṃ vinā jyeṣṭhalaṅghanena vinā akālabhojanena /
analyzed: na eva māṃsa āhāreṇa vinā uccaśayyām vinā jyeṣṭha laṅghanena vinā akāla bhojanena
translated: not with the eating of meat, not without a high bed, not without transgressing the senior, not without eating at improper times.

original: evaṃ mahārāja vidhim eva kartavyam /
analyzed: evam mahā rāja vidhim eva kartavyam
translated: Thus, Your Majesty, this is the procedure to be performed.

original: aharniśāparyante prāśanaṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: ahar niśā paryante prāśanam kuryāt
translated: At the end of day and night, one should eat.

original: punaś ca mahārāja vratasaṃpūraṇārthaṃ prativarṣaṃ vā varṣam ekaṃ vā tritayaṃ vā pañca vā sapta vā vrataṃ samāptaṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: punar ca mahā rāja vrata saṃpūraṇa artham prativarṣam vā varṣam ekam vā tritayam vā pañca vā sapta vā vratam samāptam kuryāt
translated: Moreover, Your Majesty, in order to fulfill the vow, one should perform the vow for one year, or for three years, or for five, or for seven years, when the vow is completed.🔽In between the fulfillment of the vow, a colorful umbrella should be erected.

original: vratasaṃpūraṇāntare vicitracchattraṃ ca / / / / / chattraṃ ca nānopacāreṇa kusumaprarohaṇaṃ kartavyam /
analyzed: vrata saṃpūraṇa antare vicitra chattram ca chattram ca nānā upacāreṇa kusuma prarohaṇam kartavyam
translated: An umbrella should be erected with various offerings, and the sprouting of flowers should be performed.

original: nānotsavavinoditanṛtyagītahāsyalāsyavilāsapañcasvarasaṃvṛtakālāhāreṇa puṣpākṣatapiṣṭakādiprakṣiptena dhvajaprarohaṇaṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: nānā utsava vinodita nṛtya gīta hāsya lāsya vilāsa pañca svara saṃvṛta kāla āhāreṇa puṣpa akṣata piṣṭaka ādi prakṣiptena dhvaja prarohaṇam kuryāt
translated: With various festivals, amusements, dances, songs, laughter, and plays, with the five sounds, and with food and drink, with the throwing of flowers, unbroken rice, ground rice, and so on, the sprouting of the flag should be performed.

original: yathāvidhi yajñādikaṃ kṛtvā tata ācāryāya vastrānnasuvarṇakaṅkaṇādi saṃpūraṇāya /
analyzed: yathāvidhi yajña ādikam kṛtvā tatas ācāryāya vastra anna suvarṇa kaṅkaṇa ādi saṃpūraṇāya
translated: Having performed the sacrifice and so on according to the rules, then for the fulfillment of the teacher, with clothes, food, gold bracelets, and so on.

original: evaṃ mahārāja tata ācāryāyopādhyāyena vratinaṃ maṅgalārthaṃ pratiṣṭhāṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: evam mahā rāja tatas ācāryāya upādhyāyena vratinam maṅgala artham pratiṣṭhām kuryāt
translated: Thus, Your Majesty, the preceptor should perform the consecration for the sake of auspiciousness for the one who has taken the vow.

original: tataḥ kumārīpūjanaṃ kārayet /
analyzed: tatas kumārī pūjanam kārayet
translated: Then, he should have the worship of the virgin girls performed.

original: evaṃ vidhir mahārāja /
analyzed: evam vidhiḥ mahā rāja
translated: This is the procedure, Your Majesty.

original: rājovāca /
analyzed: rājā uvāca
translated: The king said:

original: sādhu sādhu mahāprājña vratabandhaṃ mayā śrutam /
analyzed: sādhu sādhu mahā prājña vrata bandham mayā śrutam
translated: Excellent, excellent, O greatly wise one! I have heard about the vow-binding.

original: phalaṃ tasya kathaṃ nātha bhāṣasva tvaṃ yathāmatam // //
analyzed: phalam tasya katham nātha bhāṣasva tvam yathāmatam
translated: O Lord, please tell me as you think fit, what is the fruit of that?

original: śṛṇu rājan pravakṣyāmi vratarājasya yaṃ phalam /
analyzed: śṛṇu rājan pravakṣyāmi vrata rājasya yam phalam
translated: Listen, O king, I will tell you the fruit of the king of vows.

original: purā tathāgataiḥ prāha tad ekaṃ vrataśāsanam // //
analyzed: purā tathāgataiḥ prāha tat ekam vrata śāsanam
translated: In the past, the Thus-Gone Ones proclaimed that one vow instruction.

original: nirghoṣadamano nāma asurendraḥ prakīrtitaḥ /
analyzed: nirghoṣadamanaḥ nāma asura indraḥ prakīrtitaḥ
translated: The lord of the asuras named Nirghosa-Damanaka is renowned.

original: amarāvatīṃ samāsādya tiṣṭhati sukhalīlayā // //
analyzed: amarāvatīm samāsādya tiṣṭhati sukha līlayā
translated: Having reached Amaravati, he dwells with the ease of bliss.

original: tadā devānām indro dīnamanā duḥkhitaḥ sasmāra /
analyzed: tadā devānām indraḥ dīna manāḥ duḥkhitaḥ sasmāra
translated: At that time, the lord of the gods, with a dejected mind, sorrowful, remembered.

original: kena prakāreṇa vijeṣyāmi /
analyzed: kena prakāreṇa vijeṣyāmi
translated: By what means shall I be victorious?

original: mamāśrame nirghoṣadamano 'surendraḥ sthitaḥ /
analyzed: mama āśrame nirghoṣa damano sura indraḥ sthitaḥ
translated: In my hermitage, the lord of the asuras Nirghosa-Damanaka dwells.

original: tadā iti vicintya devānām indraḥ asmin trāyastriṃśadbhavane prāktanadevendraiḥ saṃpūjārthaṃ saṃsthāpitaṃ mahācaityam asti /
analyzed: tadā iti vicintya devānām indraḥ asmin trāyastriṃśat bhavane prāktana deva indraiḥ saṃpūjā artham saṃsthāpitam mahā caityam asti
translated: Then, having thought thus, the lord of the gods, in this abode of the Thirty-Three, there is a great caitya established for the sake of worship by the former lords of the gods.

original: tasmin caitye ahorātravrataṃ kriyate yathāvidhi devānām indreṇa /
analyzed: tasmin caitye ahorātra vratam kriyate yathāvidhi devānām indreṇa
translated: In that caitya, the Indra of the gods performs the one-day-and-night vow according to the rules.

original: tadanantare nirghoṣadamano 'surendro nirjitya pṛthivyām avadhāritaḥ /
analyzed: tad anantare nirghoṣa damano surendraḥ nirjitya pṛthivyām avadhāritaḥ
translated: Immediately after that, the demon king Nirghosa-daman, having conquered, took control of the earth.

original: evaṃ mahārāja īdṛśam ahorātravrataprabhāvaṃ mayā śrutam /
analyzed: evam mahā rāja īdṛśam ahorātra vrata prabhāvam mayā śrutam
translated: Thus, great king, I have heard of such power of the one-day-and-night vow.

original: rājovāca /
analyzed: rājā uvāca
translated: The king said:

original: kathaṃ bhikṣo mahāsattva tatphalaṃ tadanyad api /
analyzed: katham bhikṣo mahāsattva tad phalam tad anyat api
translated: How is that fruit, O monk, and what else?

original: bhāṣasva sakalaṃ taṃ ca vratarājasya sarvataḥ // //
analyzed: bhāṣasva sakalam tam ca vratarājasya sarvatas
translated: Please tell me everything about that king of vows.

original: śāriputra uvāca /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ uvāca
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: śṛṇu rājan mahāteja tadvratasya phalaṃ mayā /
analyzed: śṛṇu rājan mahā teja tad vratasya phalam mayā
translated: Listen, O king of great splendor, I will tell you the fruit of that vow,

original: kathyate sakalaṃ samyak paryantam ādipaścimam // //
analyzed: kathyate sakalam samyak paryantam ādi paścimam
translated: everything correctly, from beginning to end.

original: vitānam uccair prakaroti martyāḥ śridharmadhātau ḥ tathāgate vā /
analyzed: vitānam uccais prakaroti martyāḥ tathāgate vā
translated: Humans who make a high canopy in the Dharma realm or in the Tathāgata,

original: jarāvipattiṃ maraṇāntajanma tyaktvā sarogaṃ satataṃ labhante // //
analyzed: jarā vipattim maraṇa anta janma tyaktvā sa rogam satatam labhante
translated: Abandoning old age, misfortune, death, and rebirth, they always obtain freedom from disease.

original: dharmaṃ ca ratnaṃ ca mayūrapadmaṃ caturdhvajān saṃpratiṣṭhāpitena /
analyzed: dharmam ca ratnam ca mayūra padmam catuḥ dhvajān saṃpratiṣṭhāpitena
translated: By establishing the Dharma, the Jewel, the peacock, and the lotus, the four banners,

original: maitryādicatvāravihārakādīn samāpyate buddhavidāṃ balāni // //
translated: The strengths of the wise Buddhas are perfected, beginning with the four abodes of Brahmā, such as loving-kindness.

original: yena dharmadhātave vratārambhe dīyate pādyaṃ ratoadugdhādimiśritaṃ tena śucigātraṃ mahānidhiṃ pratilabhyate /
analyzed: yena dharmadhātave vrata ārambhe dīyate pādyam tena śuci gātram mahā nidhim pratilabhyate
translated: By whom water for washing the feet is offered mixed with unboiled milk etc. at the beginning of the observance for the Dharma Realm, he obtains a great treasure with a pure body.

original: tatra ācamanaṃ dhyātvā dīyate iha janmapāpāni vinaśyanti /
analyzed: tatra ācamanam dhyātvā dīyate iha janma pāpāni vinaśyanti
translated: There, having visualized the sipping water, it is offered, the sins of this birth are destroyed.

original: dharmadhātave / / / laṅghayati /
analyzed: dharmadhātave laṅghayati
translated: For the Dharma Realm... he jumps over.

original: dugdhākṣatāmbunavaratnādi śaṅkhasthāpitaṃ kurvanti narā dharmadhātave te sukhamodinyām abhilāṣaphalāny āpsyanti /
analyzed: dugdha akṣata ambu nava ratna ādi śaṅkha sthāpitam kurvanti narāḥ dharmadhātave te sukhamodinyām abhilāṣa phalāni āpsyanti
translated: Men make milk, unbroken grains, water, precious substances etc. placed in a conch for the Dharma Realm, they will obtain the fruits of their desires in the realm of happiness and joy.

original: paṭadukūlasukumārādi ye praḍhaukanti dharmadhātave te paṭadukūlavastrāṇāṃ tantusaṃkhyayā janmasu surapure paribhuñjante /
analyzed: paṭa dukūla sukumāra ādi ye praḍhaukanti dharmadhātave te paṭa dukūla vastrāṇām tantu saṃkhyayā janmasu surapure paribhuñjante
translated: Those who offer fine cotton cloth etc. to the Dharma Realm, they enjoy in the city of the gods in their births as many cotton cloths as there are threads in the cloth.

original: tilakapraḍhaukitena saundaryarūpaguṇaviśālasugandhavaraṃ tena labhyate /
analyzed: tilaka praḍhaukitena saundarya rūpa guṇa viśāla sugandha varam tena labhyate
translated: By offering tilaka, he obtains the excellent fragrance of beauty, form, and qualities.

analyzed: vicitrāṇi ca puṣpāni
translated: And various flowers...

original: api tena suvarṇalatikātulyadānasya tatphalaṃ stūpabimbe buddheṣu munayo vadanti sadā /
analyzed: api tena suvarṇa latikā tulya dānasya tat phalam stūpa bimbe buddheṣu munayaḥ vadanti sadā
translated: Even that fruit of the gift equal to a golden creeper, the sages always say in the Buddha images and stupas.

original: padotkṣepapadotkṣepam ekasuvarṇakaṃ dānam /
analyzed: pada utkṣepa pada utkṣepam eka suvarṇakam dānam
translated: With every step, the gift of one gold coin.

original: tatphalaṃ munayo jaguḥ stotram eva prakurvīta // //
analyzed: tad phalam munayaḥ jaguḥ stotram eva prakurvīta
translated: The sages have sung that as its fruit, one should perform praise alone.

original: dharmadhātave suralokaiḥ prapūjyate / / / / / / / yena gītaṃ pragīyate stūpabimbeṣu divyaśrotro bhūtvā surapure divyaghoṣaṃ śrūyate tena /
analyzed: dharmadhātave sura lokaiḥ prapūjyate yena gītam pragīyate stūpa bimbeṣu divya śrotraḥ bhūtvā sura pure divya ghoṣam śrūyate tena
translated: To the Dharma Realm, which is worshipped by the gods, by whom it is sung and praised, in the stūpa images, having become one with divine hearing, the divine sound is heard in the city of the gods.

original: dharmadhātave rājan japam ekaṃ prajapyate yena sugatajñānaṃ samāsādyate samādhiṃ punar āpyate /
analyzed: dharmadhātave rājan japam ekam prajapyate yena sugata jñānam samāsādyate samādhim punar āpyate
translated: To the Dharma Realm, O King, having muttered a single repetition, by whom the knowledge of the Sugata is attained, the samādhi is again obtained.

original: vividhavādyaṃ ye pravādyante te mahārāja dharmadhātau devaloke divyavādyaṃ pratiśrutya sthitāḥ /🔽dharmadhātustūpabimbeṣu ye nṛtyaṃ prakurvanti nānāvādyasamāyuktaṃ te suraloke sukhabhogyaṃ
analyzed: vividha vādyam ye pravādyante te mahā rāja dharmadhātau deva loke divya vādyam pratiśrutya sthitāḥ  dharmadhātuḥ tu upabimbeṣu ye nṛtyam prakurvanti nānā vādya samāyuktam te sura loke sukha bhogyam
translated: Those who play various musical instruments, O Great King, having heard the divine music in the god realm in the Dharma Realm, they remain there.🔽Those who perform dance in the stūpa images of the Dharma Realm, accompanied by various musical instruments, having attained the enjoyable pleasures in the god realm, they delight with the Gandharvas.

original: samāsādya gandharvair saha ramante nṛtyamānasya śastraastrahastena tatśastreṇa sarvapāpāni pratihanyante /
analyzed: samāsādya gandharvaiḥ saha ramante nṛtyamānasya śastra astra hastena tad śastreṇa sarva pāpāni pratihanyante
translated: For one who dances with a weapon in hand, by that weapon all the evil deeds are repelled.

original: caityabimbe ye sudhālepaṃ kurvanti te pāparāśiviṣyanditāḥ suralokam anugacchanti /
analyzed: caitya bimbe ye sudhā lepam kurvanti te pāpa rāśi viṣyanditāḥ sura lokam anugacchanti
translated: Those who apply whitewash to the caitya images, they, having shed the mass of evil, go to the god realm.

original: ye stūpabimbe dolibandhitacaturdiśāvarohanti lakṣapuṣpaguṇṭhitā vā ṣaṣṭiśatatrayapramāṇena diśāmālikās te puṣpaguṇṭhitasaṃkhyayā janmasu suraloke
analyzed: ye stūpa bimbe doli bandhita catur diśā avarohanti lakṣa puṣpa guṇṭhitāḥ vā ṣaṣṭi śata traya pramāṇena diśā mālikāḥ te puṣpa guṇṭhita saṃkhyayā janmasu sura loke  /
translated: Those who hang garlands in the four directions on a stupa image, or with three hundred and sixty garlands of flowers, in their rebirths they obtain enjoyments in the world of the gods,

original: bhogam āpnuvanti /🔽ye nānāchattraṃ vicitra / / / / / / / chattraṃ vā mahārāja pratyārohayanti te rājāno bhavanti
analyzed: bhogam āpnuvanti  ye nānā chattram vicitra chattram vā mahā rāja pratyārohayanti te rājānaḥ bhavanti
translated: to the number of the flowers in the garlands.

original: cakravartāś caturaṅgavijitavantaḥ svargānucāriṇo devalokagatā bhavanti jainapadaṃ prāpnuvanti /
analyzed: cakravartāḥ caturaṅga vijitavantaḥ svarga anucāriṇaḥ deva loka gatāḥ bhavanti jaina padam prāpnuvanti
translated: Those who hoist various umbrellas, or a great umbrella, become wheel-turning kings, conquerors of the four quarters, followers of heaven, and go to the world of the gods, attaining the state of Jina.

original: evam asya mahārāja ahorātravratarājasya phalaṃ saṃkṣepād uktaṃ mayā /
analyzed: evam asya mahā rāja ahorātra vrata rājasya phalam saṃkṣepāt uktam mayā
translated: Thus, Your Majesty, I have briefly explained the fruit of this king of one-day vows.

original: rājovāca /
analyzed: rājā uvāca
translated: The king said:

original: bhikṣusattama mahābhijña nidrāṃ na kuryād iti sevyate viśrāmaṃ na kuryād iti viśrāmaṃ kriyate tasya phalaṃ kathaṃ doṣabahulam /
analyzed: bhikṣu sattama mahā abhijña nidrām na kuryāt iti sevyate viśrāmam na kuryāt iti viśrāmam kriyate tasya phalam katham doṣa bahulam
translated: O best of monks, O greatly wise one, it is said that one should not sleep, and yet rest is taken. How can the fruit of that be so full of faults, if rest is not taken?

original: śāriputra uvāca /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ uvāca
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: nidrāviśrāmaṃ kriyate yena daśāṃśaṃ phalam āpyate /
analyzed: nidrā viśrāmam kriyate yena daśa aṃśam phalam āpyate
translated: Rest is taken by sleeping, and one obtains a tenth of the fruit.

original: atha rājovāca /
analyzed: atha rājā uvāca
translated: Then the king said:

original: bho śāriputra vratarājasya phalahīnabhūtam ittham /
analyzed: bho śāriputra vrata rājasya phala hīna bhūtam ittham
translated: O Śāriputra, the fruit of the king of vows is thus diminished.

original: asyopāyam asti kiṃ vā na vā /
analyzed: asya upāyam asti kim vā na vā
translated: Is there any means or not?

original: śāriputra uvāca /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ uvāca
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: mahārāja tasyopāyam asti /
analyzed: mahā rāja tasya upāyam asti
translated: Great King, there is a means for that.

original: kiṃtu dharmadhātuṃ praṇamyādau pañcapradakṣiṇāprayuktena aṣṭāṅgapraṇāmaṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: kiṃtu dharmadhātum praṇamya ādau pañca pradakṣiṇā prayuktena aṣṭāṅga praṇāmam kuryāt
translated: However, having bowed to the Dharma realm, one should first perform the eight-part prostration while circumambulating five times.

original: kṣamāpayitvā gauraveṇa pratiyācayet /
analyzed: kṣamāpayitvā gauraveṇa pratiyācayet
translated: Having asked for forgiveness with reverence, one should request.

original: tena sarvadoṣaṃ pratimucyate iti /
analyzed: tena sarva doṣam pratimucyate iti
translated: By that, all faults are removed.

original: evaṃ mahārāja ahorātravratasya mahānuśaṃsā mahāphalam /
analyzed: evam mahā rāja ahorātra vratasya mahā anuśaṃsā mahā phalam
translated: Thus, Great King, the great benefits and great fruits of the one-day vow.

original: brahmaghātakaṃ bālaghātakaṃ vadhyate ca sahodarastrīhatyāgovadhapāpaṃ mātṛghātakaṃ pitṛghātakaṃ stūpabhedakam /
analyzed: brahma ghātakam bāla ghātakam vadhyate ca sahodara strī hatyā go vadha pāpam mātṛ ghātakam pitṛ ghātakam stūpa bhedakam
translated: The killer of a brahmin, the killer of a child, the killer of a brother, the killer of a woman, the killer of a cow, the killer of a mother, the killer of a father, the destroyer of a stūpa,

original: asya mahāsahasrāṇāṃ saṃpūrṇaphalam āpyate prāg ekasya /
analyzed: asya mahā sahasrāṇām saṃpūrṇa phalam āpyate prāk ekasya
translated: the complete fruit of these great thousands is obtained, let alone of one.

original: tathāgatair bhāṣitaṃ tathā śrutaṃ mayā /
analyzed: tathāgataiḥ bhāṣitam tathā śrutam mayā
translated: It was spoken by the Tathāgatas and heard by me thus.

original: saptaparvatāni mṛttikākarṣāni vāparāṇi vāparaśatāni palasahasrāṇi vā palāyutalakṣaṃ vā tathaiva saṃkhyām api kalām api śaktaṃ mayā
analyzed: sapta parvatāni mṛttikā karṣāni vā aparāṇi vā apara śatāni pala sahasrāṇi vā pala ayuta lakṣam vā tathā eva saṃkhyām api kalām api śaktam mayā
translated: The seven mountains, the earth, the other mountains, the other hundreds, the thousands of palas, the ten thousands, the hundreds of thousands, even that number and part, I am able

original: na ta ahorātravratarājasya phalaparyantaṃ śakyate /
analyzed: na te ahorātra vrata rājasya phala paryantam śakyate
translated: not to the end of the fruit of the king of one-day vows.

original: evaṃ mahārāja aprameyaphalaṃ vratarājasya anyena kim /
analyzed: evam mahā rāja aprameya phalam vrata rājasya anyena kim
translated: Thus, great king, the fruit of the king of vows is immeasurable. What else is there?

original: evaṃ mahārāja dharmadakṣa saṃpūrṇaphalabhūtasya dharmāṇāṃ saptabhāgaikabhāgaṃ bhūpataye /
analyzed: evam mahā rāja dharmadakṣa saṃpūrṇa phala bhūtasya dharmāṇām sapta bhāga eka bhāgam bhūpataye
translated: Thus, great king, of the Dharma that is full of fruit, one-seventh part is for the king.

original: ekabhāgaṃ sārathījanebhyaḥ punar ekabhāgaṃ deśavāsināṃ caturbhāgān vratinām /
analyzed: eka bhāgam sārathī janebhyaḥ punar eka bhāgam deśa vāsinām catur bhāgān vratinām
translated: One part is for the charioteer and people, one part again for the citizens, and four parts for the vow-holders.

original: evam eva bhāgapramāṇaṃ mahārāja /
analyzed: evam eva bhāga pramāṇam mahā rāja
translated: Thus, great king, the measure of the parts is just so.

original: rājovāca /
analyzed: rājā uvāca
translated: The king said:

original: sādhu mahābhijña vratānāṃ vratam uttamaṃ vratarājam iti khyātaṃ satyam eva mahāmate /
analyzed: sādhu mahā abhijña vratānām vratam uttamam vrata rājam iti khyātam satyam eva mahāmate
translated: Excellent, O greatly wise one! The king of vows, known as the supreme of vows, is indeed true, O greatly wise one.

original: mamābhilāṣo 'bhūt samyak kariṣyāmīti niścayaḥ /
analyzed: mama abhilāṣaḥ bhūt samyak kariṣyāmi iti niścayaḥ
translated: I had a desire to perform it properly, and I have made up my mind to do so.

original: tatkṣaṇād eva rājñā patnīṃ vratīm āhūya ādeśitam /
analyzed: tad kṣaṇāt eva rājñā patnīm vratīm āhūya ādeśitam
translated: Immediately, the king summoned his wife, the vow-holder, and instructed her:

original: amātyapārṣadādi / / / / / / / / / daśaviṃśatijanādīn sarvān saṃnipātya mahācaityaṃ kāritavān /
analyzed: amātya pārṣada ādi daśaviṃśati jana ādīn sarvān saṃnipātya mahā caityam kāritavān
translated: Summon all the ministers, attendants, and so on, the ten, twenty, and all the people, and have them assemble. I will have a great caitya built.

original: śāriputreṇa yathādeśitaṃ sarvavidhīn sāmagrīṃ sajjīkṛtya sthitavān /
analyzed: śāriputreṇa yathā deśitam sarva vidhīn sāmagrīm sajjīkṛtya sthitavān
translated: Having had all the necessary materials prepared as instructed by Shariputra, he remained [ready].

original: tato dinān prerayām āsa /
analyzed: tatas dinān prerayām āsa
translated: Then he announced the days [of the festival].

original: tadādisamāgatapadakādiṃ sthāpitam /
analyzed: tad ādi samāgata padaka ādim sthāpitam
translated: The first stage of the assembly and so on was established.

original: caturdaśyām upavāsasthito bhūtvā madhyāhne dīpadānaṃ dīyate dharmadhātau /
analyzed: caturdaśyām upavāsa sthitaḥ bhūtvā madhyāhne dīpa dānam dīyate dharmadhātau
translated: On the fourteenth day, having fasted, at midday, the offering of lamps is made in the Dharma realm.

original: tato mukhaprakṣālanādikaṃ kṛtvā śāriputravyākhyānaṃ saṃpūrṇaṃ śrūyate /
analyzed: tatas mukha prakṣālana ādikam kṛtvā śāriputra vyākhyānam saṃpūrṇam śrūyate
translated: Then, having performed mouth-washing and so on, the commentary of Śāriputra is heard in its entirety.

original: tato 'harniśaṃ trayārdhaprahare samutthāya pratyūṣe snānādikaṃ kṛtvā vratam ārabhyate /
analyzed: tatas harniśam traya ardha prahare samutthāya pratyūṣe snāna ādikam kṛtvā vratam ārabhyate
translated: Then, having risen at the third watch of the night, at dawn, having bathed and so on, the vow is begun.

original: tato vratāntare dharmadhātuṃ pañcapradakṣiṇādilājākṣataprakṣepaṇastutigītanānotsavaprapūritena yāvac caitye devālaye tīrthe vā bahubuddhakṣetre
analyzed: tatas vrata antare dharmadhātum pañca pradakṣiṇa ādi lājā kṣata prakṣepaṇa stuti gīta nānā utsava prapūritena yāvat caitye devālaye tīrthe vā bahu buddhakṣetre
translated: Then, in the interval of the vow, having filled the Dharma realm with the throwing of five circumambulations and so on, with the scattering of unbroken rice, with praise, singing, and various festivals, up to the caitya, the temple, or the holy place, in the many Buddha-fields

original: gatavān /
analyzed: gatavān
translated: one has gone.

original: na nidrāṃ na viśrāmaṃ kārayan rātrau anekadīpaṃ pradīyate /
analyzed: na nidrām na viśrāmam kārayan rātrau aneka dīpam pradīyate
translated: Not causing sleep or rest, at night many lamps are offered.

original: praticaityadevatāyā dīpamālāṃ prajvalayan anekanṛtyagītahāsyalāsyādikaṃ kṛtvā aharniśaṃ laṅghayati /
analyzed: prati caitya devatāyāḥ dīpa mālām prajvalayan aneka nṛtya gīta hāsya lāsya ādikam kṛtvā aharniśam laṅghayati
translated: Lighting a garland of lamps for each caitya and deity, having performed many dances, songs, laughter, and plays, one passes the day and night.

original: he vajradhara yathā śāriputreṇa ādeśitaṃ trivarṣam evaṃ vidhinā pūrayitvā digmālikādiṃ vicitra / / / / chattrādiṃ pratyārohayanti /
analyzed: he vajradhara yathā śāriputreṇa ādeśitam tri varṣam evam vidhinā pūrayitvā diś mālikā ādim chattra ādim pratyārohayanti
translated: O Vajra-holder, having fulfilled in this way for three years as instructed by Śāriputra, one ascends the various banners and so on, the various umbrellas and so on.

original: tato kumāripūjāṃ kṛtvā vratapramocanaṃ kriyate /
analyzed: kumāri pūjām kṛtvā vrata pramocanam kriyate
translated: Then, having worshipped the young lady, the release of the vow is performed.

original: evaṃ vajradhara dharmadakṣamahārājena ahorātravratarājaṃ kṛtavān /
analyzed: evam vajradhara dharma dakṣa mahā rājena ahorātra vrata rājam kṛtavān
translated: Thus, O Vajra Holder, the great king Dharmadaksha performed the king of vows for a day and night.

original: sagauraveṇa tato mahārājena dharmadakṣeṇa śāriputrāya sahasramūlyaṃ muktāhāraṃ nānālaṃkārādīn vihārabhūmicīvaravastraparyantaṃ dattavān
analyzed: sa gauraveṇa tatas mahā rājena dharma dakṣeṇa śāriputrāya sahasra mūlyam muktā hāram nānā alaṃkāra ādīn vihāra bhūmi cīvara vastra paryantam dattavān
translated: With great respect, the great king Dharmadaksha then gave to Shariputra a pearl necklace worth a thousand, various ornaments and so on, and a monastery, land, robes, and cloth.

original: tato rājā yācanāgāthāṃ kṛtavān /
analyzed: tatas rājā yācanā gāthām kṛtavān
translated: Then the king composed a verse of request:

original: kṣamasva bho mahāsattva vratarājamahodaye /
analyzed: kṣamasva bho mahāsattva vrata rāja mahā udaye
translated: Forgive me, O great being, on the occasion of the great vow.

original: mama bhāgo na saṃprāptaḥ tava pādaprasādataḥ // //
analyzed: mama bhāgaḥ na saṃprāptaḥ tava pāda prasādataḥ  /
translated: I have not obtained my share, from the grace of your feet.

original: śāriputro / / / / / bhūtvā punar uvāca /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ bhūtvā punar uvāca
translated: Shariputra, having become so, spoke again:

original: tava bhāgye maharaja madgiram ekakaṃ śṛṇu /
analyzed: tava bhāgye maharaja mad giram ekakam śṛṇu
translated: In your share, great king, listen to my single word.

original: pūrvānukūlaṃ sūtraṃ ca pravakṣyāmi vidhiṃ tava // //
analyzed: pūrva anukūlam sūtram ca pravakṣyāmi vidhim tava
translated: I will proclaim the sutra favorable to the past, and the rite for you.

original: kva cin mahārāja mahāmatir nāma bodhisattvanirmitaṃ tapovanaṃ gate sati caityam ekam asti /
analyzed: kva cit mahā rāja mahāmatiḥ nāma bodhisattva nirmitam tapovanam gate sati caityam ekam asti
translated: Somewhere, great king, when the bodhisattva named Mahamati went to the forest of austerities, there is one caitya.

original: mahātavī nāma sarasī punar ekam asti /
analyzed: mahātavī nāma sarasī punar ekam asti
translated: There is another called the great lake.

original: tatra nāganāginī prativasati /
analyzed: tatra nāga nāginī prativasati
translated: There a male and female naga dwell.

original: taccaityāśramaḥ atiramaṇīyo vividhapuṣpaparipūrṇaḥ saṃchanno babhūva /
analyzed: tad caitya āśramaḥ ati ramaṇīyaḥ vividha puṣpa paripūrṇaḥ saṃchannaḥ babhūva
translated: And that shrine-grove became exceedingly delightful, filled with various flowers.

original: tasmiñ caitye pañca ṛsayo nānāsvādhyāyajapatapabhaktitaḥ pūjitavān pratidinam /
analyzed: tasmin caitye pañca ṛsayaḥ nānā svādhyāya japa tapa bhaktitaḥ pūjitavān pratidinam
translated: In that shrine, five sages daily worshipped one sage with the recitation of their own sacred texts, austerities, and devotion.

original: tatra ekasmin dine nāganāginī nāgau tatra ṛṣim ekaṃ daṃśitavān tata ṛṣiḥ sarpadaṃśitavedanāṃ vedayan śapitavān /
analyzed: tatra ekasmin dine nāga nāginī nāgau tatra ṛṣim ekam daṃśitavān tatas ṛṣiḥ sarpa daṃśita vedanām vedayan śapitavān
translated: On one day, a male and female nāga bit that one sage there. Then the sage, feeling the pain of the snake bite, cursed:

original: he nāganāginyau kimarthaṃ daṃśitaṃ mām /
analyzed: he nāga nāginyau kimartham daṃśitam mām
translated: O male and female nāga, why did you bite me?

original: saptakhaṇḍaṃ bhavantu vināśau /
analyzed: sapta khaṇḍam bhavantu vināśau
translated: Be split into seven pieces and destroyed.

original: tato nāgīnāgau śapitamātreṇa sapta śambukā janmāntare babhūvuḥ /
analyzed: tatas nāgī nāgau śapita mātreṇa sapta śambukāḥ janmāntare babhūvuḥ
translated: Then the male and female nāga, as soon as they were cursed, were reborn as seven mongooses in their next life.

original: evaṃ paribhramyamāne śambukā nāgajanme nityaṃ caityadarśanayā pūrvajanmavṛttiṃ smṛtavatyo babhūva /
analyzed: evam paribhramyamāne śambukāḥ nāga janme nityam caitya darśanayā pūrva janma vṛttim smṛtavatyaḥ babhūva
translated: Thus, while wandering, the mongooses, born as nāgas, always remembered their past life activities by seeing the shrine.

original: kasmiṃś cit caityabhaktaṛṣidaṃśitenāham itthaṃ śambukājanmam anubhūtaṃ vyākulībhūtam /
analyzed: kasmin cit caitya bhakta ṛṣi daṃśitena aham ittham śambukā janmam anubhūtam vyākulībhūtam
translated: When a sage devoted to the shrine was bitten, I experienced this birth as a mongoose, confused.

original: tataḥ kṣetre dhānyastambakaṃ caityam iti smṛtvā pradakṣiṇaṃ paribhramanti /
analyzed: tatas kṣetre dhānya stambakam caityam iti smṛtvā pradakṣiṇam paribhramanti
translated: Then, remembering that the rice stalk in the field was a shrine, they circumambulated it.

original: tataś caturthakena dinena śambukā kīrakīrtir nāma mahārājasya saptakanyakā janmapratilabdhā babhūvuḥ /
analyzed: tatas caturthakena dinena śambukā kīrakīrtiḥ nāma mahā rājasya sapta kanyakāḥ janma pratilabdhāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: Then, on the fourth day, the seven daughters of King Śambūka were born, named Kīrtikā.

original: kanyakā nītiśāstrajñā vratacāribhūtāḥ /
analyzed: kanyakāḥ nīti śāstra jñāḥ vrata cāri bhūtāḥ
translated: The daughters were knowledgeable in political science and lived a life of vows.

original: tāḥ saptakanyakās tapova / / / / / / / sadā puṣpavarṣāḥ patanti /
analyzed: tāḥ sapta kanyakāḥ sadā puṣpa varṣāḥ patanti
translated: Those seven daughters, always engaged in austerities, were showered with flowers.

original: evaṃ vividhā api kṛtvā divyapuṣpavimāne dhṛtvā sukhāvatīlokadhātau nīyante /
analyzed: evam vividhāḥ api kṛtvā divya puṣpa vimāne dhṛtvā sukhāvatī lokadhātau nīyante
translated: Thus, having performed various deeds, they were placed in a celestial flower chariot and taken to the world-system of Sukhāvatī.

original: śāriputraḥ svagṛhaṃ gatavān /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ sva gṛham gatavān
translated: Śāriputra went to his own house.

original: dharmadakṣamahārājena ahorātravratarājaprabhāvena mokṣam anuprāptam /
analyzed: dharmadakṣa mahā rājena ahorātra vrata rāja prabhāvena mokṣam anuprāptam
translated: By the power of the king of vows observed day and night, Dharma-dax, the great king, attained liberation.

original: tuṣitabhavanavāsī satsubhāso mahātmā kalimalaṃ paripūrṇaṃ dārayitvā tatra sarvavibhavasukham atulyaṃ prāptavān /
analyzed: tuṣita bhavana vāsī sat subhāsaḥ mahātmā kali malam paripūrṇam dārayitvā tatra sarva vibhava sukham atulyam prāptavān
translated: The great being Satsubhāsa, residing in the Tusita heaven, having completely shattered the impurity of the Kali Yuga, attained there incomparable wealth and happiness.

original: bhāgadheyaṃ bhavati sugatasūtraṃ śrāvayed yas tu dharmyam /
analyzed: bhāgadheyam bhavati sugata sūtram śrāvayet yaḥ tu dharmyam
translated: One who recites the auspicious sūtra of the Sugata, which teaches the Dharma,

original: tataḥ sabhājanāḥ kapilavastuni mahānagare svasvasthānam anugacchanti /
analyzed: tatas sabhājanāḥ kapilavastuni mahā nagare sva sva sthānam anugacchanti
translated: then the people go to their own places in the great city of Kapilavastu.

original: bhagavān saśiṣyaḥ samādhau sthitavān /
analyzed: bhagavān sa śiṣyaḥ samādhau sthitavān
translated: The Blessed One, together with his disciples, remained in meditation.

original: iti ahorātravratakathā samāptā /
analyzed: iti ahorātra vrata kathā samāptā
translated: Thus ends the story of the day and night vow.
